7.2 Constrained Optimization and Lagrange Multipliers 233
Figure 7.4
Illustration of
constrained
optimization. The
unconstrained
problem (indicated
by the contour
lines) has a
minimum on the
right side (indicated
by the circle). The
box constraints
(−1 ⩽x⩽1 and
−1 ⩽y⩽1) require
that the optimal
solution is within
the box, resulting in
an optimal value
indicated by the
star.
